chapter_1_The_Basics

Class Recipe_1_4_Functional_Interfaces

  • java.lang.Object
    • chapter_1_The_Basics.Recipe_1_4_Functional_Interfaces

  • public class Recipe_1_4_Functional_Interfaces
extends java.lang.Object

    (1.4.) Functional Interfaces


    1. TO DO

      - use existing functional interface or write your own

    2. HOW

      - create an interface with a single abstract method and add the @FunctionalInterface annotation from the java.lang package
      - the interface will be the target for a lambda expresion or method reference
      - the @FunctionalInterface is not required but should be used as it triggers a compile-time check that the interface satisfies the requirement. The annotation also generates a statement in the Javadoc.

      - functional interfaces can have default or static methods as well. These methods have implementation so they don't count against the SAM (single abstract method) requirement.

    3. EQ.

      • Recipe_1_4_Functional_Interfaces.MyInterface - functional interface which uses the @FunctionalInterface annotation
      • Recipe_1_4_Functional_Interfaces.MyChildInterface - functional interface which uses the @FunctionalInterface annotation
